intro: Dasyglossum antioquiaensis, commonly known as the Antioquian dasyglossum, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded, humid habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
